# IBM Social Business Toolkit Evaluation

## Setup Development Environment

Create an [IBM Social Business SmartCloud Trial][ibmsmartcloudtrial] account.

Download `SBTKDeveloperAppPackage.zip` (v01.00.00)from [developerWorks][developerworksibmsbtdownload].

[Download][eclipsedownloads] and install *Eclipse IDE for Java EE Developers*.

[Download][apachetomcat] and install *Tomcat 7.x*.

Create an application Server Runtime Environment for *Apache Tomcat v7.0* ([Eclipse Apache Tomcat Server Runtime Enviroment setup TUTORIAL][eclipseinstallingtomcat]).

Enable/ install and configure SSL support on Tomcat ([Apache Tomcat 7 SSL configuration HOW-TO][apachetomcat7sslhowto]).

Prepare the Certificate Keystore and specify a password value of "changeit":

    $JAVA_HOME/bin/keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA

Uncomment the *SSL HTTP/1.1 Connector on port 8443* in `server.xml` and add attributes `keystoreFile` and `keystorePass`:

    <Connector port="8443" protocol="HTTP/1.1" SSLEnabled="true"
        maxThreads="150" scheme="https" secure="true"
        keystoreFile="${user.home}/.keystore" keystorePass="changeit"
        clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" />

Optional - add `<security-constraint/>`  in `SBTKDeveloperApp` application `web.xml` for Tomcat to redirect the requests to the SSL port if you try to use HTTP:

    <security-constraint>
        <web-resource-collection>
            <web-resource-name>Secure Content</web-resource-name>
            <url-pattern>/*</url-pattern>
        </web-resource-collection>
        <user-data-constraint>
            <transport-guarantee>CONFIDENTIAL</transport-guarantee>
        </user-data-constraint>
    </security-constraint>

Create an Eclipse project for the sample application by importing the "Existing Projects into Workspace" and then choosing "Select archive file": `SBTKDeveloperAppProject.zip`

Register the application with the SmartCloud account (**[Administration / Manage Organization / Internal Apps]**, button **[Register App]**) providing the following properties:

    App Name: SBTKDeveloperApp
    Enable API Access via OAuth 2.0 Web Server Flow: yes
    Access Grant Duration: 90 days
    Callback URL: https://localhost:8443/SBTKDeveloperApp/Step2_A2_obtainAuthorization

 Complete the OAuth 2.0 process:

    1. Register application to obtain id, secret, uri
    2. Get Authorization Code
    3. Exchange Authorization code for Access and Refresh tokens.
    4. Use the Access token when calling the APIs.
    5. Refresh Access token when it expires using the Refresh token.

Tip: You can disable *Developer Mode* from the application later on 

Enter the application and access APIs from SmartCloud for Social Business.
